tuv.seg: Government and Dáil Éireann
An Rialtas agus Dáil Éireann
Bunreacht na hÉireann (the Irish Constitution) states that the Government is responsible to Dáil Éireann
De réir an Bhunreachta tá an Rialtas freagrach do Dháil Éireann
This means that the Government holds office only for as long as it keeps the support of the majority of the members of Dáil Éireann
Mar sin bíonn an Rialtas in oifig an fhad agus atá tacaíocht tromlach na dteachtaí i nDáil Éireann aige
The Taoiseach may resign voluntarily and if he/she does, all of the Cabinet ministers are also considered to have resigned
Is féidir leis an Taoiseach éirí as a p(h)ost dá t(h)oil féin, agus má dhéanann sé/sí é sin tuigtear go bhfuil na hairí ar fad sa chomh-aireacht éirithe as a bpost
A new nomination for Taoiseach will be put before the Dáil and the Dail will approve a new Taoiseach
Cuirfear ainmniúchán nua do phost an Taoisigh ós comhair na Dála agus ceadóidh an Dáil Taoiseach nua
If the Taoiseach fails to keep the support of the majority of the Dáil, he or she must either resign or advise the President to dissolve the Dáil
Má chailleann an Taoiseach tacaíocht tromlach na Dála, ní mór dó/dí éirí as a p(h)ost nó iarraidh ar an Uachtarán an Dáil a lánscoir
This may happen if a coalition government can no longer work together
D'fhéadfadh sé seo tarlú i gcás comhrialtais nach mbeadh in ann a thuilleadh comhoibriú lena chéile
If the Dáil is dissolved, there will then be a general election
Má dhéantar an Dáil a lánscoir beidh ollthoghchán ann
Following the election, the nomination for Taoiseach must then obtain the support of the majority of the members of the new Dáil
Tar éis an ollthoghcháin ní mór go mbeadh tacaíocht tromlach na dteachtaí sa Dáil nua ag an té a ainmnítear mar Thaoiseach
The Government meets and acts as a collective authority and is collectively responsible for all the Departments of State
Tagann an Rialtas le chéile agus feidhmíonn sé mar údarás aontaithe agus tá chomhfhreagracht ar na baill i dtaobh ranna uilig an Stáit
Discussions at Cabinet meetings are confidential
Is faoi rún a dhéantar plé ar ábhair ag cruinnithe den chomh-aireacht
The Government presents a united front and all the ministers must publicly support its major policies and decisions
Bíonn an Rialtas aontaithe ar pholasaithe agus ní mór do na hairí ar fad tacaíocht phoiblí a thabhairt do na polasaithe agus na cinnithe móra atá ag an Rialtas
The Taoiseach has the power to dismiss ministers if there is sufficient reason to do so although this power is rarely exercised
Tá sé de chumhacht ag an Taoiseach airí a chur as a bpost má bhíonn cúis mhaith aige/aici ach is go fíor annamh a dhéantar é seo i ndáiríre
It may happen if the minister has become embroiled in some public controversy or if there is a challenge to the leadership of the party
D'fhéadfadh sé tarlú dá mbeadh baint ag an aire le conspóid phoiblí nó dá mbeadh dúshlán ann do cheannaireacht an pháirtí
Ministers may also voluntarily resign
Is féidir le airí éirí as a bpost dá ndeoin féin
This may happen if the minister does not agree with a Government policy
D'fhéadfadh sé seo tarlú muna mbeadh aire sásta aontú le polasaí an Rialtais
